newsitem.title: UK: Prudential says likely to accept CE offer.
newsitem.headline: Prudential says likely to accept CE offer.

text.p: British insurer Prudential Corp Plc said on Tuesday that it was likely to accept CE Electric's 650 pence per share offer for power supplier Northern Electric Plc.
A Prudential spokesman told Reuters "we are considering our position but we are probably going to accept."
On Monday Northern finally conceded defeat in its battle with CE, which is controlled by CalEnergy Corp Inc, advising all shareholders to accept CE's 782 million stg offer.
There had been speculation that some institutional investors, led by Prudential, could try to hold out as minority shareholders.
Prudential led oppostion to CE's bid, which it regarded as undervaluing Northern, and tried to derail the offer by buying up Northern shares just ahead of the Dec 24 deadline for acceptances.

CE sources said earlier they were confident of winning full control of Northern. The U.S. utility won a narrow victory, claiming just 50.3 percent of Northern' shares by the extended deadline on Christmas Eve. CE needs 90 percent acceptances before it can compulsorily acquire the remaining 10 percent.

Prudential holds just over 12 percent of Newcastle-based Northern. Of the other major institutional shareholders still to declare their intentions, Foreign & Colonial Investment Trust Plc said it did not want to make its decision public yet. No-one at M&G Group Plc was available for comment.
